creator: vnod2805
title: Boom Box !!!
materials_required: Dead or old power bank with output of 1Ampere at least or 5V boost converter modules of 1A
Li-ion charge and discharge protection circuit
description: This project is for building a louder, portable Audio Boom Box using a PAM8403 amp board with dual power options and a USB emergency power supply. It utilizes recycled components and delivers a maximum output of 6.4 watts.
steps: Gather the necessary components, including the PAM8403 amp board, speakers, a cardboard/enclosure box, power bank, Li-ion cells, protection circuit, switches, LEDs, and wiring.
Prepare the enclosure by selecting a suitable box and cutting holes for the speakers.

Prepare the power supply, choosing between wired (USB, DC jack, or integrated AC) or wireless (alkaline/dry cells or rechargeable batteries) options. Integrate a charge/discharge protection circuit if using Li-ion cells, and consider using a power bank circuit for voltage boosting and protection. Add switches for power control and voltage selection. You may also add a USB port for emergency power backup for cellphones.
Fix the speakers to the enclosure using screws, bolts, or adhesives.

Connect the PAM8403 amp board according to the provided diagrams.  Consider adding a potentiometer for volume control. Connect the audio input via a 3.5mm aux cable (or Bluetooth module). Connect the speaker outputs and power supply, being careful not to create a common ground between the speaker outputs. Test connections.
Touch up the enclosure by covering it with decorative paper and cutting holes for switches and ports. Customize the design as desired.
